intro: Oxytropis candolleorum, commonly known as the Candolle's locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, yellow to green flowers that bloom in early spring. Oxytropis candolleorum is often found in sagebrush steppe and grassland ecosystems.
